Sentence.sentence: How does one figure out who is a weak teacher? Yes, that's a challenge.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: For example, when asked whether they  would buy a new smartphone this year, only 48 percent said yes – a six-point drop from 2015.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And it is hard not to think: Are we in an innovation lull ( ' ,  间歇期 )?In some ways, the answer is yes.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: I was a bit nervous saying yes, because I'm far from a professional.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: In some ways, the answer is yes.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: After a long silence, he said yes.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（10月） 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: If the answer to all those questions is yes, you had better control your stress, as you probably are under more stress than is good for you.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语上海卷 语法填空 B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Yes, but a few blocks down town would be much more expensive.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷I 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: Oh, yes, she is a great fan of classical music.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语浙江卷 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: With a question like this, you will get more than a "yes" or "no" reply.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 七选五 选项

Sentence.sentence: Yes , there has been a budding economic recovery since the 2008 global crash , but in key indicators in areas such as health and education , major economies have continued to decline.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: If you yell, "yes", and I yell.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

sentences.en: “Is this a painting by Picasso?” “Yes, it is.”
sentences.cn: “这是毕加索的画吗?”“是的。”

sentences.en: Yes, what you say is right.
sentences.cn: 不错, 你说的是对的。

sentences.en: His composition is good, yes, very good.
sentences.cn: 他的作文很好, 是的, 很好。

sentences.en: He smiles at you, yes?
sentences.cn: 他在对你笑, 对吗?

means.word_mean: 表示同意的答覆；表示同意的人 </seg>
是,行,好的,当然,对,完全对

lj.lj_ly: ‘Did it come as a surprise to you?’ ‘Yes and no.’.
lj.lj_ls: “这对你来说是意外吗？”“既是也不是。”。

entry.def: You use yes to give a positive response to a question.

example.ex: 'Are you a friend of Nick's?' — 'Yes.'...
example.tran: “你是尼克的朋友吗？”——“是的。”

example.ex: 'You actually wrote it down, didn't you?' — 'Yes.'...
example.tran: “你的确把它写下来了，对吗？”——“是的。”

entry.def: You use yes to accept an offer or request, or to give permission.
entry.tran: （用于接受提议或请求，或表示许可）可以，好的

example.ex: 'More wine?' — 'Yes please.'...
example.tran: “再来点酒？”——“好的。”

example.ex: 'Will you take me there?' — 'Yes, I will.'...
example.tran: “你可以带我去那儿吗？”——“可以。”

entry.def: You use yes to tell someone that what they have said is correct.
entry.tran: （用于告诉对方其所说的话正确）对，是的

example.ex: 'Well I suppose it is based on the old lunar months isn't it.' — 'Yes that's right.'...
example.tran: “噢，我想这是按照旧制阴历来算的，是吧？”——“对，是的。”

example.ex: 'That's a type of whitefly, is it?' — 'Yes, it is a whitefly.'
example.tran: “那是一种粉虱，对吗？”——“是的，是粉虱。”

entry.def: You use yes to show that you are ready or willing to speak to the person who wants to speak to you, for example when you are answering a telephone or a knock at your door.
entry.tran: （用于表示准备或愿意作出应答）什么事，来啦

example.ex: He pushed a button on the intercom. 'Yes?' came a voice...
example.tran: 他按了内部对讲机上的一个按钮。“有什么事吗？”一个声音问道。

example.ex: Yes, can I help you?
example.tran: 您好，我能为您效劳吗？

entry.def: You use yes to indicate that you agree with, accept, or understand what the previous speaker has said.
entry.tran: （用于表示同意、接受或理解前一讲话者的话）是这样，确实如此

example.ex: 'A lot of people find it very difficult indeed to give up smoking.' —'Oh yes. I used to smoke nearly sixty a day.'...
example.tran: “很多人觉得戒烟真的非常困难。”——“确实如此，我以前每天抽将近60根香烟。”

example.ex: 'It's a fabulous opportunity.' — 'Yeah. I know.'
example.tran: “这是一次非常棒的机会。”——“是，我知道。”

entry.def: You use yes to encourage someone to continue speaking.
entry.tran: （用于鼓励某人继续讲）往下说，接着呢

example.ex: 'I remembered something funny today.' — 'Yeah?'
example.tran: “我记得今天有件特别有趣的事。”——“什么事？”

entry.def: You use yes, usually followed by 'but', as a polite way of introducing what you want to say when you disagree with something the previous speaker has just said.
entry.tran: （常接but，用于礼貌地引出与前一讲话者意见不同的话）

example.ex: 'She is entitled to her personal allowance which is three thousand pounds of income.' — 'Yes, but she doesn't earn any money.'...
example.tran: “她享有的个人所得免税额是3,000英镑。”——“是的，但是她一分钱都不挣。”

example.ex: Ah yes, but think of all the family life they're missing.
example.tran: 是这样，不过别忘了他们错过了多少天伦之乐。

entry.def: You use yes to say that a negative statement or question that the previous speaker has made is wrong or untrue.
entry.tran: （用于表示前一讲话者的否定陈述或问题是错误的）不是，不对

example.ex: 'That is not possible,' she said. 'Oh, yes, it is!' Mrs Gruen insisted...
example.tran: “那不可能，”她说。“不，有可能！”格伦太太坚持道。

example.ex: 'I don't  know what you're talking about.' — 'Yes, you do.'
example.tran: “我不知道你在说什么。”——“不，你知道。”

entry.def: You can use yes to suggest that you do not believe or agree with what the previous speaker has said, especially when you want to express your annoyance about it.
entry.tran: （用于暗示不赞成或不同意前面讲话者的话，尤用于表示厌烦）真的吗，行啦

example.ex: 'There was no way to stop it.' — 'Oh yes? Well, here's something else you won't be able to stop.'
example.tran: “没法阻止它。”——“是吗？哼，那这还有些别的事也是你没法阻止的。”

entry.def: You use yes to indicate that you had forgotten something and have just remembered it.
entry.tran: （用于表示刚刚想起忘记的事情）对了

example.ex: What was I going to say. Oh yeah, we've finally got our second computer.
example.tran: 我刚想说什么来着。噢，对了，我们终于有了第二台电脑。

entry.def: You use yes to emphasize and confirm a statement that you are making.
entry.tran: （用于强调并确认自己的陈述）对，一点没错

example.ex: He collected the £10,000 first prize. Yes, £10,000.
example.tran: 他领取了1万英镑的头奖。对，是1万英镑。

entry.def: You say yes and no in reply to a question when you cannot give a definite answer, because in some ways the answer is yes and in other ways the answer is no.

example.ex: 'Was it strange for you, going back after such a long absence?' — 'Yes and no.'
example.tran: “那么长时间不在，然后又回来，你会觉得陌生吗？”——“既陌生又不陌生。”

entry.def: A yes is a person who has answered 'yes' to a question or who has voted in favour of something, or the answer or vote they have made.

example.ex: The no-votes are leading the yeses...
example.tran: 反对票领先于赞成票。

example.ex: The noes have 50 percent, the yeses 35 percent and the rest are undecided.
example.tran: 反对者占50%，赞成者占35%，其余人尚未决定。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English gēse, gīse, probably from an unrecorded phrase meaning 'may it be so'

sentences.cn: 攻读一个大学专业的费用要么值得支付,要么不值得｡如果值得,就不需要纳税人承担学费｡如 果不值得,纳税人承担学费是不合理的｡无论是否值得,纳税人都没有理由为大学生的大学教育费用买单。
sentences.en: Either a college major is worth its cost or it isn’t. If yes, taxpayer financing isn’t needed. If not, taxpayer financing isn’t desirable. Either way, taxpayers have no business paying for students’ college education.

Sentence.sentence: Is it possible to enjoy a peaceful life in a world that is increasingly challenged by threats and uncertainties from wars, terrorism, economic crises and a widespread outbreak of infectious diseases? The answer is yes, according to a new book The 10 Golden Rules: Ancient Wisdom from the Greek Philosophers on Living a Good Life.
